title: Protonation state and solubility of benzoic acid

Benzoic acid, <math alttext="H C 7 H 5 O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>HC</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, has a <math alttext="p K sub a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>p</mtext><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> of 4.20 and a molar solubility of <math alttext="0.0278 molar" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.0278</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. Sodium benzoate, <math alttext="N a C 7 H 5 O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NaC</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, has a molar solubility of <math alttext="4.16 molar" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4.16</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. Several <math alttext="50.0 milliliters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>50.0</mn><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.20em"></mspace><mtext>mL</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> samples of <math alttext="2.00 molar N a C 7 H 5 O 2 aqueous " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.00</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>NaC</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> are treated with <math alttext="3.00 molar H C l " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3.00</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>HCl</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, the <math alttext="p H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is recorded, and any solid crystals are filtered, dried, and weighed. The data from the experiment are given in the table above. Which of the following best explains the experimental results?

choices.label: When <math alttext="p H is less than p K sub a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext><mo><</mo><mtext>p</mtext><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="the molar concentration of H C 7 H 5 O 2 is greater than the molar concentration of N a C 7 H 5 O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>HC</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext><mo>></mo><mtext>[</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>NaC</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="H C 7 H 5 O 2 solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>HC</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> precipitates from the solution.

When <math alttext="p H is less than p K sub a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext><mo><</mo><mtext>p</mtext><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="the molar concentration of N a C 7 H 5 O 2 is greater than the molar concentration H C 7 H 5 O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>NaC</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext><mo>></mo><mtext>[</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>HC</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="N a C 7 H 5 O 2 solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NaC</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> precipitates from the solution.

When <math alttext="p H is greater than p K sub a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext><mo>></mo><mtext>p</mtext><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="the molar concentration of H C 7 H 5 O 2 is greater than the molar concentration N a C 7 H 5 O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>HC</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext><mo>></mo><mtext>[</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>NaC</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="H C 7 H 5 O 2 solid " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>HC</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> precipitates from the solution.

When <math alttext="p H is greater than p K sub a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext><mo>></mo><mtext>p</mtext><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="the molar concentration of N a C 7 H 5 O 2 is greater than the molar concentration H C 7 H 5 O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>NaC</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext><mo>></mo><mtext>[</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>HC</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="N a C 7 H 5 O 2 solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NaC</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> precipitates from the solution.
